elements.title: Ye Olde White Harte (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ye Olde White Harte, reputed to be "one of Hull's most haunted pubs", has a skull of unknown provenance (pictured) in the bar?

elements.title: 2022 Boca Raton Bowl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2022 Boca Raton Bowl was the first bowl game loss in Liberty program history after three wins in their first three appearances?

elements.title: Nergisî (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after a lifetime of feeling undervalued, Nergisî gained the appreciation of the Ottoman sultan and was sent to the front as a chronicler, only to fall from his horse and die on his way?

elements.title: a Washington state radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Washington state radio station turned to "professional bikini watchers"—military recruiters—to report on crowds at local beaches?

elements.title: Ephraim E. Lisitzky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ephraim E. Lisitzky wrote an epic poem in Hebrew based on Native American legends?

elements.title: Paul Delvaux Museum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Paul Delvaux Museum exhibits not only Paul Delvaux's paintings, but also a collection of model trains?

elements.title: Gao Ruona (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chinese physician Gao Ruona's son, son-in-law, and student all served as editors at the Song government's Bureau for Editing Medical Texts?

elements.title: 59th Street–Columbus Circle station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after a CCTV system was installed at the 59th Street–Columbus Circle station, crime went up?
